extendedIngredients.name: artichokes
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup artichokes (drained from can – reserve ½ cup of liquid)

extendedIngredients.aisle: Pasta and Rice;Canned and Jarred;Ethnic Foods
extendedIngredients.name: garbanzo beans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 15.5 oz can garbanzo beans (chickpeas) – drained & rinsed

recipes.title: Spinach Artichoke Hummus with Shamrock Shaped Green Peppers

winePairing.pairingText: Hummus works really well with Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. The Bellissima Sparkling rosé with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: Add the garbanzo beans, garlic, tahini, spinach and artichokes to a food processor.Juice the lemon into the food processor then drizzle the olive oil through the top as you blend.Blend for 30 seconds or until the hummus is smooth and creamy.Place in a bowl and refrigerate for 10-15 minutes.Remove the tops of each bell pepper and clean the seeds and membranes out of the middle.Use the palm of your hand to gently smash the bell pepper flat.Slice the bell pepper in half, then use a shamrock shaped cookie cutter to cut the bell pepper.

steps.step: Add the garbanzo beans, garlic, tahini, spinach and artichokes to a food processor.Juice the lemon into the food processor then drizzle the olive oil through the top as you blend.Blend for 30 seconds or until the hummus is smooth and creamy.
Place in a bowl and refrigerate for 10-15 minutes.

Remove the tops of each bell pepper and clean the seeds and membranes out of the middle.Use the palm of your hand to gently smash the bell pepper flat.Slice the bell pepper in half, then use a shamrock shaped cookie cutter to cut the bell pepper.
